  • Something

2023 - Charged Up

Rafiki

This season, the BullBots had to create a robot that could intake and place both cones AND cubes onto shelves called the "grid." Thus, Rafiki was born with a versatile wheeled intake and grabbing arm mechanism that worked for both game pieces. Rafiki was also our first competition bot with a swerve drivetrain, which was a lot of fun to see running at both the Ventura County and Idaho Regional!

2022 - Rapid React

Clampy

This season was full of excitement, and Clampy's swift and effective climbing mechanism carried us straight to the finals at the Idaho regional. Rapid React presented a new challenge of climbing not one, but four gradually higher rungs to reach the traversal, and Clampy did just that! We also were able to score this year’s game piece ("oversized tennis balls") in both possible scoring locations.

2021 - Infinite Recharge - At Home challenge

Walter 2.0

Despite the global pandemic that shut the world down, the robotics efforts still continued with our previous season’s robot Walter. We competed in several at home challenges, and in September, Walter had another chance to compete in-person at the Idaho Invitational off-season event. We took home two Quality Awards and learned a lot despite the circumstances.

2020 - Infinite Recharge

Walter

It was pretty cool. I was a freshman and had no clue what was going on.

2019 - Deep Space

Recursion

This robot was designed to place "hatch panels and Cargo".

2018 - Power Up

Unser Wagon

Unser Wagon is German for "Our Wagon", named this because the robot features a long shopping cart-like handle that allows other robots to hook onto the back. Unser Wagon has been to a finals and a semi finals match and preformed over 4 double climbs.

2018-offseason - T-Shirt Cannon

Amaterasu

Amaterasu has been the dream of the team since the beginning. Before our 2018 Season began, we built Amaterasu to encourage more young engineers to join the Bullbots. It has bright blue and green LED's and speakers for style points. Also, it is extremely fun to shoot empty Gatorade bottles.

2017 - Steamworks

Skybound

Skybound excels in collecting gears and running them to the airship. Skybound also has a special climber that can latch onto any rope. It features a saw-blade on a mini-sim motor, which allows the robot to climb, but prevents the robot from slipping off the rope. The saw-blade mechanism that Skybound used to climb the rope won the Creativity award. Skybound is one of our smaller robots, weighing in at only 86 lbs. Skybound is happily active and frequently used for demos.
